intro: Macrorhamnus faraloatra var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved faraloatra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
